## Steps to reproduce

When using New-FileCatalog, powershell fails on specific file name combinations and returns an error.

Reproduction steps:
1. Create file: `--a=b.ext`
2. Run `New-FileCatalog -File "--a=b.ext" -CatalogFilePath "test.cat" -CatalogVersion 2.0`
3. Optionally: put text/content into `--a=b.ext`

## Expected behavior

```none
Catalog entry is created for file
```

## Actual behavior

```none
'New-FileCatalog: Unable to find file b.ext=C:\<path>\--a=b.ext to hash.'
```

The cmdlet seems to be attempting to parse the '--<a>=<b>' part as if it was part of the command and not the filename.
The <a> and <b> parts are optional, it can be boiled down to "C:\<path>\--=" and still fail.

If <b> has contents, that will be what is shown in 'Unable to find file <b>`

If you put something/text into the '--a=b.ext' file and run 'Get-Content --a=b.ext' the command returns to contents of the file, so it is specific to New-FileCatalog and not to the underlying powershell engine

Affects both 7.1 and 5.1

title: New-FileCatalog is improperly parsing/sanitizing filenames of files to be cataloged
